I would recommend "We the Living" as it is a compelling story about survival and resistance in political upheaval. The movie stars Ayn Rand, who is known for her philosophical works and is considered one of the most influential writers of the 20th century.
The plot of "We the Living" is set during the Russian Revolution, where a group of people are forced to survive together under extreme circumstances. The movie follows the lives of several characters, including Kira, who wants to be a builder, and the two men who love her - Leo, an aristocrat, and Andrei, a Communist.
Throughout the movie, we see the characters and their relationships develop, as they try to survive together under extreme circumstances. We also see the different interests each seems to take in the event.
